recipe.ingredients: - cod fillets: 4 (6-ounce pieces) - olive oil: 2 tablespoons - garlic (minced): 3 cloves - lemon juice: 2 tablespoons - fresh parsley (chopped): 2 tablespoons - paprika: 1 teaspoon - salt: 1/2 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
recipe.directions: 1. Preheat Oven: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). 2. Prepare Cod: Pat the cod fillets dry with paper towels and place them in a baking dish. 3. Make Marinade: In a small bowl, mix together the olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, chopped parsley, paprika, salt, and black pepper. 4. Apply Marinade: Pour the marinade evenly over the cod fillets, making sure each fillet is well coated. 5. Bake: Place the baking dish in the oven and bake for about 12-15 minutes, or until the cod flakes easily with a fork. 6. Serve: Garnish with additional parsley and lemon slices if desired.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 2g, Dietary Fiber: 0.5g, Sodium: 350mg, Saturated Fat: 1g, Total Fat: 10g, Protein: 31g, Cholesterol: 65mg, Total Sugars: 0.5g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 1228 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Cod Fillets: 828 calories (138 calories per 6-ounce fillet) Olive Oil: 239 calories for 2 tablespoons Garlic: 13 calories (for 3 cloves) Lemon Juice: 8 calories for 2 tablespoons Parsley: Minimal Paprika: Minimal Salt and Black Pepper: Negligible - Serving People: 4
